author: sky.cactus
content: <@574864862338088960> My plan was to push for 1559 to depend on 2718 after 2718 is final.  I am hesitant to push for converting 1559 to depend on 2718 until then because depending on non-final EIPs can create a new roadblock in adoption.  That being said, if the lack of typed transactions are making it hard to actually implement 1559, then maybe it is worth the roadblock?

author: abdel.stark
content: <@!301186049323958275> I agree having a roadblock is not ideal. Let's discuss that during the implementers call. I know you wont be able to make it. Do you have a strong opinion on this topic ?

author: sky.cactus
content: I do think 1559 should use 2718 if possible, and if 2718 goes to final and is flagged for inclusion in a fork on or before the 1559 fork, then I will strongly advocate that 1559 uses 2718.

author: sky.cactus
content: 2718 came out of my initial 2711 EIP (meta transactions).  When drafting that up I quickly realized that we were having the same problem in 1559, 2711, Rich Transactions (https://github.com/Arachnid/EIPs/blob/richtx/EIPS/EIP-draft-rich-transactions.md), EIP-55, EIP-155, and a few other places and it was time to solve the problem more generally.  ðŸ™‚

author: abdel.stark
content: Ok that makes sense. I strongly agree with you. I will represent your voice during the call ðŸ™‚

author: timbeiko
content: <@!301186049323958275> I think it kind of makes sense to push them both in a same hard fork, otherwise you are pushing back one of the two for 6-9 months. So in that case, they would both get to "final" at the same time.

author: sky.cactus
content: Hmm, I may be canfusing the Core EIP process with the process of other subtypes.

author: sky.cactus
content: Okay, correction to the above.  I would like to get 2718 to ACCEPTED before lobbying hard for 1559 to depend on it.

author: sky.cactus
content: That being said, if people are generally in favor of 1559 depending on it sooner I won't fight that.  :)

author: abdel.stark
content: <@!552133098075193354> +1 for pushing them in the same hard fork.

author: timbeiko
content: <@!301186049323958275> I think it's more realistic you get it EFI, and then both 1559 and 2718 will be accepted at the same time. In the past, we accepted the EVM versioning EIP because there was an EIP that needed it. We then "unaccepted" it when the EIP requiring it didn't make it in.

author: timbeiko
content:
**EIP 1559 Implementers' Call 3 in ~25 hours**
Agenda: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/184
Zoom: https://zoom.us/j/94667577331
Stream (first ever!): https://youtu.be/NEwo0v0zCUA

author: sky.cactus
content: There is also 2711 that already depends on 2718 as a "first user" of sorts.

author: sky.cactus
content: Again, I'm not against EIPs depending on 2718 if people think that makes the most sense, the above is just my personal reasoning on why I was waiting to push hard for it's inclusion.  :)
